intro: Pteroselinum alsaticum var. venetum, commonly known as Italian parsley, is a cultivar of the parsley family (Apiaceae) characterized by its finely divided, bright green foliage. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is often cultivated for its aromatic leaves used in cooking. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are rich in essential oils, contributing to its distinctive flavor and fragrance. This variety is well-suited for both culinary use and ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardiness.
